content.description:
This is the short but worth wild beginner off width.Crux is down low the crack has great holds in back.

Warning at the time we first did this roots a large barn owl flew out and almost taloned my brother in the back of his neck. He was able to fend it off before any real injury was sustained.
content.location: Wide crack Located 10 feet right of The Cowboy and 20 feet left of The Red Diamondback.

content.description: Climb the broken chossy face to chimney until it becomes possible to tackle monster off width.
content.location: Located on the right side of the Wild West Wall. Obvious 5 inch butt crack off width splitting the white headwall.

content.description: Classic Old Castle off the deck traverse. Start as for Bemo's Chimney or Bemo's Corner. Once you have topped out either of these route traverse horizontal crack system right to left across upper headwall of Wild West Wall.
content.location: Obvious horizontal crack system that runs along the top headwall section of the Wild West Wall.

climbs.name: The Good The Bad and The Ugly

content.description: The Good The Bad and The Ugly starts via a technical side pull mantle into a shallow right facing mini dihedral. Core dependent stem fest up blankness will get you to the top!
content.protection: TR same anchor as Chisum use directional .5 & .75 cams in horizontal at top of climb to prevent swing left.
content.location: Obvious feature 10' right of the Chisum hand crack. Start of large flat boulder.

content.description: Climb the amazing hand and fist crack to the splitter pac man roof fist crack.
content.protection: Gear to 5 inches, gear anchor to 3 inches.
content.location: Fist Full of Dollars is the obvious Pac-Man roof crack located on the western portion of the Wild West cliff band. It is located 10 feet to the right of True Grit and 10 feet left of the Hex Choke Stopper.

climbs.name: The Cowboy AKA The Hex Choke Stopper

content.description: Climb up and over a brilliant overhanging left facing dihedral 25 feet. Exiting around the arête out right at the top is the crux. Climb varied discontinuous cracked features another 30 feet to top.
content.location: Located just right of Fist Full of Dollars.

content.description: Superclean splitter straight in hand crack.
content.protection: Gear to 2 inches, slung block for anchor at top.
content.location: Obvious 30' hand crack located at the extreme left end of the Wild Wild West Wall.

content.description: Climb the short but sweet left facing off width body squeeze chimney/ flake. Crux is just before wide off width ends and you are able to climb up and left on face features.
content.protection: Gear to 4 inches, gear anchor up and left.
content.location: Located at the extreme right margin of the Wild West Wall. Just  left of pitch two of Bemos Corner. Just right Of old-school tagging of BEMO!

content.description: This is the direct roof finish variation to High Plains Drifter. Instead of traversing left at the end of the birdshit corner, climb directly out of roof via an awkward double gastone chimney face move over lip of roof.
content.location: Same start as High Plains Drifter.

climbs.name: High Planes Drifter
climbs.fa: Jonathan Reinig, Daniel Browning, Joshua Reinig.

content.description:
This is the radical dirty birdshit covered right facing corner, capped by a roof in which you traverse out left via a perfect horizontal hand crack. When it become possible to mantle up out of roof into shallow chossy dish/corner there is one pod in middle of dish that takes a .5 I believe?

From here make a couple moves and climb unbelievable Finger crack/right trending flake!!!
content.location: Located center right off Wild West Wall. Start is obvious bird shit right facing corner. 100 feet left of Bemo's Chimney.

climbs.name: The Shootist AKA The Red Diamondback

content.description:
The Shootist is the classic sustained left veering dog leg off width, located in the center left of the Wild West Wall.

Also known as The Red Diamondback for the giant red diamond back rattle snake that takes up residency at the start of this climb.

He is very old and wise if you do not mess with him he will not mess with you. Climbed around him dozens of times.
content.location: Obvious left veering dogleg crack to the right of Two Mules for Sister Sara.

content.description:
Don't let the name confuse you this is anything but a grit route. By the time you are done with this Wild West test piece you will feel like a One Eyed Whiskey Drinken John Wayne.

Tech stemming and arête climbing will get you to the downward facing fin of a roof. Pull through this inconceivable roof (The Crux), and climb wicked sustained bouldery moves to top.
content.location:
Located at the left end of Wild West Wall. 15 feet around the corner to the right of The Good The Bad and The Ugly, 10 feet left of

Fist Full Of Dollars.

Starts in large obvious left facing corner that narrows at the top just before the roof.
